intro: Acoridium binuangense, commonly known as the Binuang arrowroot, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as taro and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
